author: ÐÐ»ÐµÐº Ð‘. ÐŸÐµÑ‚Ñ€Ð¾Ð²ÑÐºÐ¸
title: "Bombs were falling everywhere" - Testimony of people fleeing the airstrikes in Lebanon - Free Press
text: "Bombs were falling everywhere" - Testimony of people fleeing the airstrikes in Lebanon Israel's attacks on Hezbollah targets have had a chilling effect on local civilians, who have been forced to flee place after place in search of safety. Cross-border attacks by Israel and Hezbollah have displaced tens of thousands of people on both sides, reports "[with the BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cly3g1dplppo)". In Lebanon, recent Israeli airstrikes have killed 600 people, injured thousands and displaced another 90.000. Some of those fleeing their homes told the BBC of their experiences, leaving their possessions behind, relying on strangers to survive. Among them is Valentin Nesser, a journalist who fled southern Lebanon with her mother and brother on Monday, as intense bombardment made Lebanon's deadliest day in decades. "We went to Mount Lebanon, about 30 minutes from Beirut, which is currently considered a safe zone," she said. Their journey took 15 hours due to heavy traffic as thousands tried to escape. "We came here with nothing because the bombs were everywhere and we want to be safe as soon as possible," she added. We are in a hotel that has been turned into a center for displaced people and now there are more than 300 people and counting. We have, for example, 50 people in the same room. Many people have still not found a place to stay and some have been forced to sleep in their cars. She said local authorities were providing food and water, adding that although she had lived through periods of conflict before, this time was different. "This time there is more tension, more sadness, more anger, Neser said.

author: T. Nieva | D. Menor
title: Â«El Papa es un paciente frÃ¡gil. No estÃ¡ fuera de peligroÂ»
text:
Secciones
Servicios
Destacamos
T. Nieva | D. Menor
Viernes, 21 de febrero 2025, 17:59
Â«El Papa es un paciente frÃ¡gil. No estÃ¡ fuera de peligroÂ». Aunque la evoluciÃ³n del Santo Padre parece ir por el buen camino, ya ... que no tiene fiebre tras ser diagnÃ³sticado de una neumonÃ­a bilateral, el equipo mÃ©dico que le asiste en el hospital Gemelli de Roma ha lanzado este viernes un mensaje de precauciÃ³n ya que se trata de una persona de 88 aÃ±os con antecedentes mÃ©dicos complicados. Han adelantado que seguirÃ¡ ingresado Â«el tiempo que sea necesarioÂ». Se da por seguro, en este sentido, que continuarÃ¡ en el centro Â«al menosÂ» la prÃ³xima semana.
La infecciÃ³n que padece, segÃºn los doctores, es Â«muy compleja y estÃ¡ extendidaÂ». Â«Necesita unos dÃ­as para que el tratamiento siga evolucionandoÂ», han indicado los mÃ©dicos, que recalcan que Francisco se Â«encuentra de buen humorÂ».
Los mÃ©dicos han ofrecido una rueda de prensa cuando se cumple una semana del ingreso. Francisco, segÃºn habÃ­a informado este viernes el Vaticano, ha pasado Â«bienÂ» la noche, se ha levantado y ha desayunado. Los partes mÃ©dicos de los dos Ãºltimos dÃ­as hablan de una Â«leve mejorÃ­aÂ» en sus condiciones clÃ­nicas.
Mientras sigue ingresado en el hospital Gemelli, hay miembros de la jerarquÃ­a eclesiÃ¡stica que han comenzado a reconocer en pÃºblico que existe la posibilidad de que Francisco renuncie al pontificado si, cuando reciba el alta mÃ©dica, no se encuentra con las condiciones fÃ­sicas necesarias para seguir adelante con el cargo. Â«Si tuviera dificultades graves a la hora de desarrollar su servicio, tomarÃ¡ una decisiÃ³nÂ», seÃ±alÃ³ el cardenal Gian Franco Ravasi, antiguo responsable del 'ministerio' de Cultura vaticano. El arzobispo de Sevilla, JosÃ© Ãngel Saiz Meneses, ya se refiriÃ³ en los dÃ­as anteriores a esta misma posibilidad. Â«Si ve que no puede atender bien su misiÃ³n, tanto Ã©l como otros Papas que vengan puedan dejar el primadoÂ», seÃ±alÃ³ en Canal Sur Radio.
Francisco ha dejado claro en diversas ocasiones que no tendrÃ¡ problema en seguir los pasos de Benedicto XVI y renunciar al pontificado si no se encuentra con las facultades fÃ­sicas o mentales suficientes para desempeÃ±ar el cargo. De hecho, incluso dejÃ³ preparada su renuncia como obispo de Roma desde poco despuÃ©s de su elecciÃ³n en marzo de 2013. Lo hizo al darle una carta al cardenal Tarcisio Bertone, en aquella Ã©poca secretario de Estado, el 'nÃºmero dos' de la Santa Sede, en la que explicaba que en caso de impedimento Â«por cuestiones mÃ©dicasÂ», no seguirÃ­a liderando la Iglesia catÃ³lica. Lo desvelÃ³ el propio Bergoglio en una entrevista con 'Abc' publicada en 2022 en la que, en cualquier caso, subrayaba que Â«se gobierna con la cabeza, no con la rodillaÂ», por lo que no iban a ser los problemas de movilidad que arrastra estos Ãºltimos aÃ±os las que le llevaran a renunciar.
La diferencia es que ahora afronta Â«una dificultad estructural que afecta a una funciÃ³n vital fundamental como es la respiraciÃ³nÂ», como destacÃ³ en el 'Corriere della Sera' Ravasi, quien destacÃ³ que Â«una cosa es la rodilla y otra cuando uno siente que el cuerpo entero estÃ¡ en dificultadÂ». Â«Todo es posibleÂ», manifestÃ³ por su parte el cardenal Jean-Marc Aveline, arzobispo de Marsella. Estas especulaciones sobre una eventual renuncia de Francisco no han gustado nada al decano del Colegio Cardenalicio, el purpurado italiano Giovanni Battista Re, quien ha invitado a Â«no inventar cosasÂ» y ha asegurado en declaraciones a 'La Repubblica' que Â«dentro de unos dÃ­as el Papa volverÃ¡ al VaticanoÂ».

author: Ashleigh Banfield
title: NOLA jail janitor formally charged in May 16 escape - NewsBreak
text: ( NewsNation ) â€” A former maintenance worker at the New Orleans jail where 10 inmates escaped May 16 has been formally charged with assisting the breakout as his attorney continues to accuse authorities of scapegoating Sterling Williams. The 33-year-old Williams shut off the water that day after someone purposely clogged a toilet at the problem-plagued Orleans Parish Justice Center, his attorney, Michael Kennedy, told â€œBanfieldâ€ on Wednesday. He said Williams denies doing it so that inmates could remove the commode to slip through a wall, as authorities allege. â€œHe was the jail plumber,â€ Kennedy said. â€œHe entered the tier. There was a toilet that had been stuffed full of jail clothing, towels, etc., forcibly overflowed. In order to clear it, he was forced to turn off the water. Thatâ€™s his job. â€œWe do expect that evidence is going to prove that as soon as discovery is tendered.â€ This week, the Louisiana attorney generalâ€™s office charged Williams with 10 counts of â€œprincipal to simple escapeâ€ and one count of malfeasance in office. He has been jailed since May 19 â€” one of several people accused of assisting the escaped inmates. Williams remains held on $1.1 million bond. Kennedy offered an explanation in response to reports that one of the inmates had threatened to â€œshankâ€ Williams if he didnâ€™t turn off the water. Williams told investigators the inmate had threatened to stab him, but not as a reprisal if he didnâ€™t cooperate, he said. â€œThat was jailhouse banter,â€ the attorney said. â€œIt was misconstrued as being the reason he turned off the water.â€ Of the 10 inmates who escaped, nine have been recaptured. Convicted murderer Derrick Groves is still at large. For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to NewsNation.

author: Chloe-Lee Longhetti
title: Little Mermaid's Halle Bailey welcomes son after secret pregnancy - 9Celebrity
text:
Singer and actress Halle Bailey has welcomed her first child with rapper boyfriend DDG, after keeping her pregnancy a secret.
The Little Mermaid star, 23, announced the happy news on Instagram ï»¿on Sunday, revealing the pair welcomed a son named Halo.
"Even though we're a few days into the new year, the greatest thing that 2023 could have done for me, was bring me my son..." she said in her post.
Singer and actress Halle Bailey has welcomed her first child with rapper boyfriend DDG. "Welcome to the world my halo ðŸ¥°ðŸ‘¼ðŸ½ âœ¨," she said.
She added in regards to persistent rumours she was pregnant: "The world is desperate to know you."
Underneath the post, stars including Nicki Minaj and Halle Berry commented.
READ MORE: Taylor Swift's sexuality questionedï»¿
She announced the happy news on Instagram ï»¿on Sunday, revealing the pair welcomed a son named Halo. (Instagram) READ MORE: ï»¿ Last photo of the Friends cast before they were famous
Minaj wrote: "Welcome to earth, Halo. We've been expecting you. Congrats Mama!"
Berry added: "Congratulations, Halle. Welcome to motherhood and welcome to the world baby Halo."ï»¿
Kylie Jenner added an angel and love heart emojis. ï»¿
READ MORE: Cher's son has conservatorship requestï»¿
In November, the singer hit back at a comment about her supposedly having a ''pregnancy nose''. (Instagram) Bailey and DDG, 26, whose real name is ï»¿Darryl Dwayne Granberry Jr., have been dating since March 2022, when they went Instagram official.
In November, the singer hit back at a comment about her supposedly having a ''pregnancy nose'' amid rumours she was expecting. She never confirmed her pregnancy.
''If I see one more person say something about my nose one more time, it's gonna be hell to pay,'' she said in a video at the time.
She added in part of the clip: "Leave me the hell alone."ï»¿
